title: The Neither Here Nor There Zone
name: The Neither Here Nor There Zone
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

Airports. Train stations. Highway meridians. Bridges. Hallways and Corridors. A celebration of the passage from one Place to another.

properties.name: Airplane Sink With No Water
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingAirline so cheap they don\'t even have water in the johnThey don\'t feed you, they don\'t give you headphones, they don\'t have enough blankets, and they don\'t even have water for hand washing in the toilets. Moist toweletts indeed. I\'ve noticed recently that my entering an airplane toilet induces turbulence.

properties.name: Airplane Toilet Overflow
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingShortly after leaving Portland, the airplane toilet overflowed. Flight attendants gathered up blankets to stem the tide of smelly blue running water. Eventually they managed somehow to fix it and the pilot made a announcement about "the flight crew aka roto router plumbers." I hadn\'t heard anyone say "Roto Router" since I was a kid. "Roto Router, that\'s the name, and away go your troubles down the drain."

properties.name: An Airport Somewhere
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingI can\'t even remember where the heck this wasI can\'t even figure out which arport this was. Not Newark...I don\'t think....Houston? Houston has some pretty spiffy atuff in the airport. Couldn\'t have been Raleigh.... Some airport somewhere. If anyone recognizes this, fill me in.

properties.name: Baggage Claim, Houston Airport
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Bus Stop (location inexact)
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: Found a horse that wasn't tethered.
properties.description: Posted by Jasonairport in san diego, caAfter finding so many of the horses tied to horse-ties in Portland, it was a surprise to find yet another plastic horse under a seat in the airport terminal.

properties.name: Fox News Store
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ Terminal CIt\'s sort of like the Disney Store, only... um... Fox News themed. Also at George Bush International Airport: Echo Chamber Bookstore Outlets

properties.name: Fully Booked--Outlets
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingTerminal CThis is the book store of terminal C. It\'s not bad. They have a wide selection. They also have these cute little outlet stations so you can charge up your laptop or phone while you browse. George Bush Airport is pretty well equiped with outlets in terminal C. There are many pillars in the waiting area, all of them having at least two outlets. Unfortunately there are also a lot of TV sets, mostly playing CNN. Also at Gerorge Bush International Airport Fox News StoreEcho Chamber

properties.name: Gate C84, my favorite.
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingThis is my favorite gate at Newark because you can see it from the bar right next to it, so you can sit and have a beer while you watch your flight delay time. Very nice! The Out of Bounds is an ok bar for an airport sports bar. They\'re friendly.

properties.name: Gates C87 and C88. The Dungeon.
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingThese are my least favorite gates in terminal C. You have to go down an escalator to a cramped little spot below ground. There\'s not even a soda machine down there.

properties.name: Hallway Exit Sign
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing404 NW 10th Ave Portland, ORI think that this is one of the most alienating hallways I know. If you plopped me down in this hallway from out of nowhere, I am pretty sure I would have no idea where I was even though I walk through it so often. When I walk through this hallway I get the feeling that there is no guarantee that I am going to find anything I expect to find at the other end of it.

properties.name: Ichigao Station
properties.description: Posted by ShingoIchigao StationIchigao Station, Denentoshi Line

properties.name: In-Terminal Craft Fair
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ Â Â Terminal A, NewarkEarly February in the corridor of terminal C there was an in-terminal craft fair. I don\'t know whether or not this is a regular occurrance, but I did enjoy imagining what it was like for the TSA running all of these handicrafts and flea-market style goods through the security line. I woldn\'t want to be in line behind this set up. Also at Newark Airport: Terminal AOut of Bounds Sports BarView From the Skytrain

properties.name: Jet Fuel Beach
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ Â Saint MaartenWhen Erik and I went to Club Orient with Tali and Kyle we flew in over jet fuel beach. It is really amazing.

properties.name: John Wayne Airport
properties.description: Posted by BaostarJohn Wayne Airport has one of the shortest runways, at 5,701 feet, restricting its commercial use to aircraft no larger than a Boeing 757. The short runway length, combined with noise restrictions, requires an unusual takeoff at or near full power, with a steep climb followed by a sudden reduction in power and a sharp turn.

properties.name: Light Installation at Chicago O'Hare
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ Â terminal 1 between concourses B and CThis is a piece by Micheal Hayden. A lot of the neons are burned out now, which is a pity, but it\'s still impressive. I wish more airports were like this

properties.name: Malpensa Airport Milan
properties.description: Posted by MattkennedyMalpensa Airport Milan

properties.name: Midway Inernational Airport
properties.description: Posted by Phototron 5700 South Cicero Avenue Chicago, Illinois 60638Lots of people from Chicago going to Hawaii in track suits and Hawaiian shirts. Me sleeping under a bench going to new York.

properties.name: Mr. Yoshida Wants You to Try his Sauces
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ 7000 Northeast Airport Way, Portland, OR, 97218This advertisement looks like it has been here since about 1975. All of the colors have faded from it except for shades of greyish blue. Whenever I see it I spend about four seconds trying to pinpoint what it is about this ad that makes it feel un-contemporary. There is a sister billboard somewhere else in the airport where we are informed that Mr. Yoshida used to give his sauces away for free [the he discovered capitalism.] That one is easy to pinpoint. The cold war is over. But this one...Maybe it\'s just that karate is an 80s phenomenon. Maybe karate\'s been replaced by Kung fu... do kids know what a black belt is still?

properties.name: New York Subway Times Square
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingTimes Square, NY

properties.name: Newark International Airport
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingTerminal A, NewarkFlying from Boston to Portland on Continental through Newark, you come in to terminal A and you have to change terminals, to terminal C for the connection. The worst part about this is that you have to go through security again. Terminal A is a pretty confusing, round place. There is only one way out, but it\'s not very easy to see. The signage in general at this airport is pretty bad. To compensate they usually have two or three airport employees hanging out around the sky train. I never hang out in terminal A, just pass through. It doesn\'t look like a fun terminal to hang out in, though the lighting is really good. It has the typical giant windows all \'round, and a big, central skylight. Also at Newark Airport: Out of Bounds Sports BarView From the SkytrainIn-Terminal Craft Fair

properties.name: Out of Bounds, terminal C
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ My current favorite airport bar. Don\'t know why.Soemthing about this bar appeals to me. It\'s proximity to the gate I usually leave from is of course one big factor. It\'s a bit grittier somehow than most airport bars. I also like the name of it. Very much neither here nor there...Out of Bounds. Also at Newark Airport: Terminal AView From the SkytrainIn-Terminal Craft Fair

properties.name: Out the Window over Iowa
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingFlying to Fort Dodge, Iowa, you take a tiny little plane (a Saab) with one stop in Mason City, from Chicago.

properties.name: Outlet Repair in a Hallway at Newark Airport
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingI stopped between flights to take this picture of a man repairing one of the many outlets they have at the airport in Newark. These outlets are placed right in the middle of walkways. I imagine that they once belonged to little islands of pay phones which have since become less urgently necessary and less numerous.

properties.name: Outlets near gate 133 terminal C
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingThe outlets are in the floor, not on the walls. There are a few on the walls, but not many and some of them don\'t work. These are spaced along the outside edge of where the seats are. Between the seats and the food court, but in the carpeted area. Anyway, the main thing is look down at the ground, not along the walls.

properties.name: Outside Terminal C
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingYou can take a Continental shuttle between gates A and C in Newark, to avoid having to go in and out through security.

properties.name: Parking Pay and Jungle Sounds
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishinglogan airport

properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: San Jose del Cabo Airport
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: The Food at PDX Airport is Exceptionally Bad
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ Â 7000 Northeast Airport Way, Portland, OR, 97218I\'ve eaten at the Windemer Pub (very disgusting) and at the Good Dog Bad Dog restaurant (predictably bad).

properties.name: Tokaido Shinkansen
properties.description: Posted by BaostarKyoto, JapanI was traveling on the Shinkansen (Bullet Train) from Kyoto to Nagoya at night at the speed of 300 km/h. I remember looking out of the window and seeing the streaking lights bending and folding as I passed by. I thought all the headlights look like they were organisms; the taillights were like blood cells; and the highway, as a whole, was the human body that function with these flowing, restless parts.

properties.name: Tram Stop
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: View From Gate 135
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing

properties.name: View from terminal A
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Newark

properties.name: View from the Sky Train
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingThe shuttle train which takes you between terminals is elevated and you get a view of the outside of the airport. Also at Newark Airport: Terminal AOut of Bounds Sports BarIn-Terminal Craft Fair

properties.name: Windmills
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingÂ We saw these windmills out the window of the plane. I didn\'t know that Iowa was into wind power. With a little research I found this USA Today article. Mason City this week became the first Iowa town to set rules that allow windmills in commercial, industrial and residential zones. The City Council unanimously approved the ordinance Tuesday. City planner Tricia Sandahl says the council initially considered permitting windmills only in industrial areas. "Then we decided, let\'s just take a bolder step," she says. "We wanted to encourage small wind systems in residential areas. With electric prices going up, it just makes sense."

properties.name: Yeager Airport
properties.description: Posted by Lmalone100 Airport Road, Charleston, WV 25311Airport serving the greater Charleston metro area and southwestern and central West Virginia.
